brief_title: Study of Licarbazepine in the Treatment of Manic Episodes of Bipolar Disorder
brief_summary: This purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Licarbazepine for the treatment of manic episodes of bipolar disorder.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - Diagnosis of bipolar disorder (type I) with manic or mixed episodes (including patients with/without psychotic features or with/without a history of rapid cycling) - In need of psychiatric treatment - Cooperation and willingness to complete all aspects of the study Exclusion Criteria: - Current diagnosis other than bipolar I disorder - History of schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder - Drug dependence within 1 month prior to study start or testing positive in a urine drug test - Suicide attempt within 1 month prior to study start or at immediate risk of harm to self or others - Any form of psychotherapy within 1 month prior to study start
